title: How to Make a Three Way Phone Call on a Mobile Phone

steps.title: Call the first person.
steps.content: Call the first person. Dial their number as you would normally do, and let them know you're going to add the third person.

steps.title: Activate three-way calling.
steps.content: Activate three-way calling. Quickly press and release the hang-up (or flash) button. Don't linger, or you'll hang up on the first person!

steps.title: Dial second person.
steps.content: Dial second person. Wait till you hear the dial tone, then call the second person. When they answer, let them know you're setting up a three way.

steps.title: Press and release the hang-up (or flash) button.
steps.content: Press and release the hang-up (or flash) button. Now all three of you are connected.

steps.title: Call the first person.
steps.content: Call the first person. When that call is established, tap "add call."

steps.title: Call the second person.
steps.content: Call the second person. When that second call is established, tap "Merge Calls."

steps.title: To drop one person from the call:
steps.content: To drop one person from the call: Tap "Conference," tap the red phone icon next to the person, then tap "End Call."

steps.title: To talk privately with one of the parties:
steps.content: To talk privately with one of the parties: Tap "Conference," then tap "Private" next to the person. Tap "Merge Calls" to continue the conference.

steps.title: Note:
steps.content: Note: For GSM phones (generally AT&T plans) you can add up to five people to a call; CDMA phones (usually Verizon), the options are more limited. See the owner's manual and your service plan for details.

steps.title: Call the first person.
steps.content: Call the first person. When that call is established, dial the number of the second person.

steps.title: Press SEND.
steps.content: Press SEND. When you press this, the first person is put on hold, and the call is made.

steps.title: Press SEND again.
steps.content: Press SEND again. When the second person answers, press SEND to create the conference call. If the second person does not answer, press SEND twice to end the connection and return to the first person. Note per Verizon: If you are traveling and the instructions don't work, or if you are in OH, MI, MN, SD or Southern IL, you will also need to press SEND before dialing the number of the second person.

steps.title: Call the first person.
steps.content: Call the first person. When that call is established, press the "Flash" button.

steps.title: Dial the second person.
steps.content: Dial the second person. When they've answered, press "Flash" again.
